title: Sheriff: Teen girl shot and killed by friend playing with shotgun
content:
POMONA PARK, Fla. — A 16-year-old girl died early Sunday morning in Putnam County after she was shot by a friend who was playing with a shotgun, according to the Putnam County Sheriff's Office.
At 4:30 a.m., a 16-year-old boy at the girl's house in Pomona Park shot the young girl with a loaded 12-gauge shotgun. PCSO reported that the boy accidentally shot Rayne Michelle-Marie Dettmann, 16, and hit her in the upper body.
The boy had been picked up by some friends at 3:00 a.m. after sneaking out of his home, deputies said.
The boy arrived with friends at the home on the 100 block of Pine Avenue in Pomona Park shortly after being picked up, according to authorities.
Witnesses told deputies that the boy found the shotgun in the home and began to playfully point it at other people. When he pointed it at the 16-year-old girl, he pulled the trigger once, police said.
The others in the house called police immediately while the 16-year-old boy reportedly put pressure on the wound until EMTs and police arrived at the home, according to PCSO.
The young girl was taken to Putnam County Medical Center where she was pronounced deceased.
Putnam County authorities have charged the boy with one count of negligent homicide and committing a second-degree felony with a firearm. Authorities have since turned the boy over toe juvenile detention officials.
There were three others in the home Sunday morning. Two juveniles and one adult, police said. No adults were present that lived in the home.
